3: At this trade fair, eight pieces of merchandise will be put on display.
After that, they will go through four rounds of inspection. The best one selected from them will be accepted by the Lady Qu.
What I have prepared will blow everyone's socks off! Just watch!
Just wait and see.
...I feel like the plan doesn't quite align with the objective.
Now to present the merchandise number seven—

2: I think it's your showtime now.

3: Commandant.
Do I really have to... go about this mission dressed like this?

4: If you don't feel comfortable doing this, Lucia...

3: No... It's just... I feel a little, weird about it...
Lucia, you look great in this outfit!
I don't... think so...
Lucia, you look great in this outfit!
I'm doing this for the mission, to reach Qu. I shouldn't...
Anyway... I'll be getting on stage.
That woman who briefly appeared behind the curtain... was that Qu?
Yes, that was her, KCC's leader... At every trade fair, she's kept isolated on a high platform and no one is allowed to go near her.
You mean like imprisoned?
Huaxu has been forcing Qu to find a vessel for him on this ship...
But just like you, she has no choice but to obey Huaxu, right?
Right. The Kowloong Crew has power, but we can't use it against Huaxu. Hell, some of us even got comfortable living like this.
And will they stand in the way of our mission?
As far as I can tell, Chaofeng, Fuxi, and I are the last holdouts who are still trying to rescue the leader and set ourselves free.
The rest of the Kowloong Crew are ambiguous in their stance. And I suspect that some of them have already had their minds transferred...
The only one to watch out for is Yazi.
She's been guarding the leader.
As the conversation continues, Lucia walks up the stage as instructed. The mechanical puppets around her snap into action.
Lucia, here to present you with a dance of blades.
